content:
Here are some healthy breakfast ideas that can be prepared in 15 minutes or less:

**1. Overnight Oats**: Mix rolled oats, milk, and your choice of nuts, seeds, or fruit in a jar. Refrigerate overnight and enjoy in the morning. (5 minutes prep, 10 minutes soak)

**2. Avocado Toast**: Toast whole grain bread, mash an avocado, and spread on top. Add a fried egg or a sprinkle of red pepper flakes for extra protein. (5 minutes)

**3. Greek Yogurt Parfait**: Layer Greek yogurt, fresh berries, granola, and a drizzle of honey in a bowl. (5 minutes)

**4. Peanut Butter Banana Toast**: Toast whole grain bread, spread with peanut butter, and top with sliced banana. (3 minutes)

**5. Smoothie**: Blend your favorite fruits, yogurt, and milk to create a quick and nutritious breakfast smoothie. (5 minutes)

**6. Scrambled Eggs**: Scramble eggs with spinach, mushrooms, and a sprinkle of feta cheese. Serve with whole grain toast or a whole grain wrap. (10 minutes)

**7. Cottage Cheese and Fruit**: Mix cottage cheese with fruit like berries or sliced peaches for a high-protein breakfast. (5 minutes)

**8. Whole Grain Waffles with Fresh Fruit and Yogurt**: Toast whole grain waffles and top with fresh fruit and a dollop of yogurt. (10 minutes)

**9. Hard-Boiled Eggs**: Boil eggs the night before and keep in the fridge for a quick protein-packed breakfast on-the-go. (10 minutes prep, 5 minutes cook)

**10. Chia Seed Pudding**: Mix chia seeds with milk and let it sit overnight. Top with fresh fruit and nuts in the morning. (5 minutes prep, 10 minutes soak)

These breakfast ideas are quick, healthy, and delicious. You can also customize them to fit your dietary preferences and ingredient availability.
